definitions.definition: The character or fundamental values of a person , people , culture , or movement .
A form of rhetoric in which the writer or speaker invokes their authority , competence or expertise in an attempt to persuade others that their view is correct.

The traits in a work of art which express the ideal or typic character, as influenced by the ethos (character or fundamental values) of a people, rather than emotional situations or individual character traits in a narrow sense; opposed to pathos .

main_definition: The character or fundamental values of a person , people , culture , or movement .
secondary_definitions: ( rhetoric ) A form of rhetoric in which the writer or speaker invokes their authority , competence or expertise in an attempt to persuade others that their view is correct.

( art ) The traits in a work of art which express the ideal or typic character, as influenced by the ethos (character or fundamental values) of a people, rather than emotional situations or individual character traits in a narrow sense; opposed to pathos .
